revised_title: Observations on Whale Flesh, Whale Eye Crystalline Humor, and Fish Eyes
tldr: The author, Antony van Leeuwenhoek, examines the flesh of whales, the crystalline humor of whale and fish eyes, and the structure of fish eyes. He observes the fine fibers and structure of the crystalline humor and compares it to that of other creatures. He also notes that some flat fish, like flounders, can cover their eyes, which helps protect them from damage.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
